[Home](./index.md) &gt; [@rushstack/operation-graph](./operation-graph.md) &gt; [Stopwatch](./operation-graph.stopwatch.md)

## Stopwatch class

Represents a typical timer/stopwatch which keeps track of elapsed time in between two events.

**Signature:**

```typescript
export declare class Stopwatch 
```

<table><thead><tr><th>

Method


</th><th>

Modifiers


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

[reset()](./operation-graph.stopwatch.reset.md)


</td><td>


</td><td>

Resets all values of the stopwatch back to the original


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[start()](./operation-graph.stopwatch.start.md)


</td><td>


</td><td>

Starts the stopwatch. Note that if end() has been called, reset() should be called before calling start() again.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[start()](./operation-graph.stopwatch.start.md)


</td><td>

`static`


</td><td>

Static helper function which creates a stopwatch which is immediately started


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[stop()](./operation-graph.stopwatch.stop.md)


</td><td>


</td><td>

Stops executing the stopwatch and saves the current timestamp


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[toString()](./operation-graph.stopwatch.tostring.md)


</td><td>


</td><td>

Displays how long the stopwatch has been executing in a human readable format.


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>
